dublin_core.dcvalue: Lifestyle related health risks such as overweight work stress and physical inactivity have become pervasive in most modern societies These risk factors have a debilitating impact on the wellbeing of citizens and play a major role in the onset of many chronic diseases As a result working life is affected due to impaired work ability decreased productivity absenteeism and disability pensions Lifestyle changes are the key to managing these problems but they are often difficult to accomplish and maintain We present a concept for ICT Information and Communication Technology assisted health promotion in the occupational healthcare ICT tools are provided for employees participating in a face to face intervention which is designed to address several health risks We believe that through ICT we can provide the employees with more personalized health management support more efficiently than before The ICT system will be implemented by integrating different technologies into an interoperable system
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:19:21Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2007-11-16
Conference proceedings : ... Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. Annual Conference
A concept for ICT assisted health promotion in the occupational healthcare.
